summary: This bill, the "No Bribes for Politicians Act of 2025," aims to curb corruption and enhance financial transparency within the federal government. It mandates biannual financial disclosure reports for federal officials, expands disclosure requirements to include relatives of the President, Vice President, and cabinet secretaries, and prohibits the President and Vice President from certain business activities, including holding financial interests, using their name/likeness for profit, and serving in decision-making roles within for-profit entities. It also restricts the use of gifts for Presidential duties. The Act seeks to increase ethical conduct and reduce conflicts of interest.
